page.title: 05INHAM HALL
page.content: INHAM HALL The actual date the house was built is not known. In a book called "Buildings of England" by Bevsler, it is stated that it was built in 1723 but this cannot be proved. It is known, however, that the barn was built in 1814 and the Coach House in 1825. The house was originally called Comers Halt but was changed to Inham Hall in the late 1860's, by the Peckovers. The reason for this was that the land immediately behind the house was called Inham Field. The original house was three cornered and the western section was built much later. The whole front of the house has also been changed since the original building. Previous owners of the house include the Williamsons-who later moved to the Manor House. The Clarkes, the present owners, have been there since 1917.
